intro: Elaeosticta korovinii, commonly known as the Korovin's elaeosticta, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers bloom in clusters, adding a delicate appearance to its habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
